Name: Potato Early Blight
Description: Potato Early Blight is a common fungal disease that affects potato plants, caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It can cause circular or irregular-shaped lesions on the leaves, which can expand and merge over time. The lesions are usually surrounded by a yellow halo and can lead to defoliation of the plant if left untreated.

Products.Chlorothalonil: A broad-spectrum fungicide that can be applied preventively or curatively. It is effective against a wide range of fungal diseases, including Potato Early Blight.

Products.Mancozeb: Another broad-spectrum fungicide that is effective against Potato Early Blight. It works by inhibiting fungal cell respiration and can be applied preventively or curatively.

Products.Copper-based fungicides: Such as copper hydroxide, copper sulfate, and Bordeaux mixture - can also be used to control Potato Early Blight.
